caUrl.description: A URL to a Fulcio-compatible CA, capable of receiving Certificate Signing Requests (CSRs) and responding with issued certificates. This URL **MUST** be the "base" URL for the CA, which clients should construct an appropriate CSR endpoint on top of. For example, if `ca_url` is `https://example.com/ca`, then the client **MAY** construct the CSR endpoint as `https://example.com/ca/api/v2/signingCert`.

oidcUrl.description: A URL to an OpenID Connect identity provider. This URL **MUST** be the "base" URL for the OIDC IdP, which clients should perform well-known OpenID Connect discovery against.

tlogUrls.description: One or more URLs to Rekor-compatible transparency log. Each URL **MUST** be the "base" URL for the transparency log, which clients should construct appropriate API endpoints on top of.

tsaUrls.description: One ore more URLs to RFC 3161 Time Stamping Authority (TSA). Each URL **MUST** be the **full** URL for the TSA, meaning that it should be suitable for submitting Time Stamp Requests (TSRs) to via HTTP, per RFC 3161.

SigningConfig.title: Signing Config
SigningConfig.description: SigningConfig represents the trusted entities/state needed by Sigstore signing. In particular, it primarily contains service URLs that a Sigstore signer may need to connect to for the online aspects of signing.
